key_insight: Neural stochastic differential equations that learn state-dependent drift and diffusion can accurately model and generate single‑cell dynamics, producing realistic trajectories and enabling in silico perturbation experiments. This approach outperforms prior methods by explicitly capturing both deterministic trends and state-dependent stochasticity.
problem_solved: Modeling the complex, stochastic, and state-dependent dynamics of cells from single‑cell time series data — including realistic uncertainty and the ability to simulate counterfactual perturbations — where prior methods either ignore state‑dependent noise or lack generative/causal simulation capabilities.
method: Parameterize continuous‑time dynamics as neural stochastic differential equations (SDEs) with neural nets for state‑dependent drift and diffusion.
Train the model on single‑cell trajectory/timecourse data using continuous‑time inference to fit both mean dynamics and noise structure.
Use the learned generative SDE to sample realistic trajectories and perform in silico perturbations by modifying drift/diffusion or inputs to study developmental and disease scenarios.
impact: Provides ML practitioners a principled, uncertainty‑aware continuous‑time generative framework for systems with stochastic dynamics, enabling higher‑fidelity simulations, interpretable dynamic models, and practical counterfactual experiments in biology and other time‑dependent domains.
visual_elements: Diagram of a neural SDE: arrows showing learned drift field and state‑dependent diffusion cloud around trajectory
Overlay of observed single‑cell trajectories and generated trajectories in latent or gene‑expression space
Bar/line chart comparing predictive performance and uncertainty calibration versus baseline models
Heatmap or flow visualization showing outcomes of in silico perturbations (pre/post intervention)
paper_title: Learning cell dynamics with neural differential equations
paper_authors: Michael E. Vinyard, Anders W. Rasmussen, Ruitong Li, Allon M. Klein, Gad Getz
